titleStmt.title: R. V. Rowland, Sr. et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9844

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency The Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

We the undersigned citizens of Calloway & Marshall Counties would respectfully represent to your excellency That at a late term of the Calloway county Equity & Criminal Court Josiah. P. Starks a citizen of Marshall County was convicted of breach of the peace and fined the sum of $28 50/100 dollars. We would represent that said Starks resides some 8 miles from Murray the County seat of Calloway when the judgment was rendered and was sick and unable to attend Court at the time of trial. We would further represent to your Excellency that said Starks is a poor man with a large family and ordinarily a peaceable and quiet citizen. For these among other considerations we would most earnestly reccommend his case as one worthy to receive Executive
Interposition, and hope your Excellency will grant the prayer of your humble petitioners by immediatley remitting said fine for which we ever pray &c

R V Rowland Snr
R V Rowland Jnr
H. W. Williams
Solomon, Williams
John Connar
P. S. Pace
m P Cope
T, F, Starks
James Williams
S. P, Stark
